abstract.p: Letter by Liberal Party director Martin I Hassner emphasizes that Mayor Rudolph Giuliani's friendship with party leader Raymond B Harding does not guarantee Giulianiparty's endorsement for any office he seeks (S)

block.p: Re ''A Liberal Endorsement'' (letter, May 10): Let's hope that the old adage that if you say the same thing often enough people will believe it works as well for the truth.

What has to be absolutely clear about the famous friendship between Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani and the Liberal Party's leader, Raymond B. Harding, is that it has not and will not guarantee Mr. Giuliani the party's automatic support for any office he seeks.
Re ''A Liberal Endorsement'' (letter, May 10): Let's hope that the old adage that if you say the same thing often enough people will believe it works as well for the truth.

What has to be absolutely clear about the famous friendship between Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani and the Liberal Party's leader, Raymond B. Harding, is that it has not and will not guarantee Mr. Giuliani the party's automatic support for any office he seeks.

That truth has been clearly understood by the political leadership that surrounds Hillary Rodham Clinton, or she would not have attended the Liberal Party's policy committee meeting last weekend. She joins the thousands of candidates who have recognized the value and merit of the Liberal Party's endorsement for elected office in New York State.
MARTIN I. HASSNER Exec. Dir., Liberal Party New York, May 11, 2000
